results.title: Timber
results.brief_description: A survey of the forests from which Australia obtains timber supplies for firewood, building and other industrial purposes. Illustrates tree-felling and the various methods used to transport logs to timber-mills. Overviews the preservation of natural forests and revegetation programs.

results.title: Tim to the seashore
results.creator_credit: Gateway Film Productions, Anthony Larsen, Sam Pillsbury and Rod Prosser
results.brief_description:
Short non-narrated film of a small boy’s meanderings and discoveries along a beach. Aims to assist in the development of communication skills.
Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Tim Roth: made in Britain
results.creator_credit: BBC, Damon Thomas and Emily Fielden
results.brief_description: Profiling British actor Tim Roth who has worked extensively in Hollywood (Reservoir dogs, Pulp fiction, Planet of the apes), this documentary was filmed in 1999, when Roth, tired of the actor’s lot, was directing and promoting his directorial debut “The War zone”. In interview Roth discusses his influences, experiences both as a fledgling actor and successful star, fame, his upbringing, hopes for the future, feelings about his craft and desire to retire from acting and pursue directing. As a young thespian Roth started off in theatre before landing a key role in “Made in Britain”, a controversial TV movie about juvenile delinquency, which enabled Roth to forge ahead with a successful film career. Roth was subsequently cast in “Jumpin’ at the Boneyard” (1992) which led to a key role in “Reservoir dogs” (1992), Quentin Tarantino’s ultra-violent heist film that made several unknown actors famous. Also interviewed are school friends, colleagues, fellow actors Ray Winstone, Gary Oldman, Chris Penn and John Hurt, Mike Leigh who directed Roth in “Meantime” (1981), and Tom Stoppard director and writer of “Rosencrantz and Guildenstern are dead” (1990). Features extensive footage of Tim Roth shooting “The War zone” using inexperienced actors and shows Roth dealing with the mixed critical reception that his film received in the UK.

results.title: Tim Burton official opening : Tim Burton : the exhibition
results.brief_description: This film highlights the excitement and celebration of the official opening of ‘Tim Burton: the exhibition’. A night filled with colour and sound. Amongst the fire eaters, stilt walkers and burlesque performers were the Tim Burton fans waiting to get a glimpse of their idol. The festivities start with the red carpet for VIPs that ran along the Flinders Street entrance and eventually inside ACMI’s Lightwell the official opening speeches were delivered.

results.title: Tim Burton @ ACMI : Highlights of Tim Burton's visit to ACMI
results.brief_description: This is a highlights package of Tim Burton’s time at ACMI. It showcases the events that Tim Burton participated in as well as the peripheral activities that occurred around the Exhibition set up and launch. A celebration of Tim Burton and the exhibition, it includes footage of Tim Burton meeting with the young tour guides, book signings, the masses that filled Federation Square to see the sold out event of Tim Burton’s Masterclass, Burton Club, Media Launch, Official Opening as well behind the scenes footage of installations such as the BatMobile and Balloon Boy.

results.title: Tim
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Colleen McCullough this is the story of an affair between an older woman and a young intellectually disabled man she meets when he becomes her gardener. Starring Piper Laurie and Mel Gibson.

results.title: Tilt
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, World Bank and Wolf Koenig
results.brief_description: A wryly amusing, surrealistic animation using the analogy of the Earth to a ball in a pinball machine being manipulated by pressures arising from inequitable allocation of resources. Emphasises the urgency of finding suitable solutions to the Earth’s problems, how a little more sharing of wealth by the “have” countries might ease many of the world’s economic ills and presents three alternatives. Script by Don Arioli.
